inputs.selection_motivation: US 10‑year Treasury yields are a primary discount‑rate driver for equity valuations; a rise in the 10‑year compresses the S&P 500, making the yield a direct influencer of the index.
inputs.candidate_motivation: US 10Y Treasury Yield is a core benchmark for U.S. debt markets; it is directly driven by Fed policy, term‑structure dynamics (2Y, 5Y, 30Y yields), inflation expectations, and the dollar index, while also correlating with global benchmark yields (Bund, Gilt, JGB), ECB policy, and equity markets.

proposed_link.motivation: US 10‑year Treasury yields are a primary discount‑rate driver for equity valuations; a rise in the 10‑year compresses the S&P 500, making the yield a direct influencer of the index.
